title: How to Make White Chocolate Chunk Cookies

steps.headline: Preheat your oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit (176 degrees Celsius).
Cream the butter and both sugars.
steps.description: Use a whisk or electric mixer. Once creamy and smooth, add the eggs and vanilla and mix once more.

steps.headline: Add the cocoa powder and mix on low speed.
steps.description: Add the baking soda and salt and mix well, making sure to incorporate any ingredients that stick to the sides of the bowl.

steps.headline: Add the flour and mix on high.
steps.description: Make sure that the cookie dough is at the right consistency. Once it is, fold in the chocolate chunks.

steps.headline: Roll the dough into balls and place on a cookie sheet.
steps.description: Do not press it with a fork as they easily spread. Place them in the oven and bake for 15-20 minutes.

steps.headline: Let them cool on a wire rack.

text: Preheat your oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit (176 degrees Celsius).  Cream the butter and both sugars. Use a whisk or electric mixer. Once creamy and smooth, add the eggs and vanilla and mix once more. Add the cocoa powder and mix on low speed. Add the baking soda and salt and mix well, making sure to incorporate any ingredients that stick to the sides of the bowl. Add the flour and mix on high. Make sure that the cookie dough is at the right consistency. Once it is, fold in the chocolate chunks. Roll the dough into balls and place on a cookie sheet. Do not press it with a fork as they easily spread. Place them in the oven and bake for 15-20 minutes. Let them cool on a wire rack. Enjoy!
